posts.cooked: the negcon, a playstation controller made for ridge racer. The middle twists so it could be used for the rotation, with the 4 directional pad for movements. outside of the limits for like 8 directions it has potential.

Could you probably implement it for the sake of doing so? Absolutely. Should you use it in competition? No, probably not. The D pad resolution would be terrible compared to a traditional stick and you are very much limited to cardinal directions.

That is unless next year’s game is FIRST Chess presented by Haas and Chess.com a part of the 2026 Season: Sand presented by Qualcomm.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: Pedro Braga
posts.cooked:
To be honest, now I kinda wanna try driving a good field oriented swerve+an elevator with one of these, it feels like it could be a quite intuitive control scheme.

That still leaves us with two axes(pitch and roll), and even though pitch might be intuitive enough for an arm, I think the opportunities for accidentally triggering wrong inputs would be too high.

Negcon was THE best racing controller for the PS1. Analogue steering, analogue buttons. Most PS1 racing games used it. All Ridge racer games, Wipeout 1 & 2 You could use it for all Namco games even Tekken. Wish they made a mordern version.
